title.value: Human local field potentials in motor and non-motor brain areas encode upcoming movement direction
title.justification: The paper focuses on understanding how neural oscillations in both motor and non-motor brain areas can predict upcoming movement directions by decoding spectral features from local field potentials.
title.quote: Human local field potentials in motor and non-motor brain areas encode upcoming movement direction

extractions.description: This paper explores the ability to decode hand movement directions from local field potentials (LFPs) in both motor and non-motor brain areas during movement planning and execution phases, utilizing machine learning approaches on intracranial EEG data from epilepsy patients.

type.justification: The research employs empirical methods by using real intracranial EEG data acquired from human subjects to perform machine learning-based decoding of movement directions.
type.quote: we set out to probe the directional-tuning of oscillatory features during motor planning and execution, using a machine learning framework on multi-site local field potentials (LFPs) in humans.

name.justification: The study is primarily focused on understanding neural signals and their relationship to motor function, which falls under the domain of neuroscience.
